definition: to wrap/to pack/to put leftovers in a doggy bag for take-out/to package (computing)
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: She then took the chicken bones home and made soup out of them.
sentences.chinese: 然後她把雞骨頭打包回家，做成了湯。

sentences.english: Ha ha. I bet they play this and then announce the event is over.
sentences.chinese: 哈，我打包票他們演奏完後宣佈發佈會結束。

sentences.english: PE Packer is used for paper box, paper case, color printing corporation, etc.
sentences.chinese: 聚乙烯自動打包機用於紙盒，紙箱彩色印刷公司。

sentences.english: There were books too, we will pack everything and make sure there are clean .
sentences.chinese: 還有圖書哦，雖然現在有點亂，但是我們會打包好哦。

sentences.english: Check out this interactive checklist before you start to pack.
sentences.chinese: 在開始行李打包前核對一下物品清單。

sentences.english: Well, the Vegetable Orchestra promises just that.
sentences.chinese: 蔬菜管絃樂隊可以打包票。

sentences.english: These are worlds packaged as mcworld files.
sentences.chinese: 它們是被打包成mcworld文件的地圖。

sentences.english: I packed it because it didn't need ironing, but I felt wrong.
sentences.chinese: 因爲他們不用熨燙我就打包過來了，但我不想穿。

sentences.english: The failure rate is reduced and efficiency is increased in the renovated bundling machine.
sentences.chinese: 改造後的打包機故障率降低並提高了效率。

sentences.english: The original lucky star big market, packed with the latest version of the software trade.
sentences.chinese: 原版的大福星行情繫統，打包了最新版的交易軟件。

sentences.english: We’ll just get a doggie bag.
They bought a special machine for baling.
sentences.chinese: 他們買了個專門的打包機。
當然，這種事情我們不能打包票。

sentences.english: This Machine is used for Foam Blocks & Foam Matress Compressing, Sealing then Packing into small Capacity.
sentences.chinese: 本機主要用於泡綿體和泡綿牀墊的壓縮封邊打包工作。

sentences.english: If you order too much food you can ask the waiter to give you a doggy-bag.
sentences.chinese: 如果你點的菜沒喫完，可以要求服務員給你打包。

sentences.english: Package materials securely and label as "Mercury-Contaminated.
sentences.chinese: 把東西妥善地打包並標上“被水銀污染”。

definition: to put together an order and deliver it (i.e. 配貨|配货[pei4 huo4] and 送貨|送货[song4 huo4])/to deliver (goods)
to mark down (the price of goods)/to sell off cheap
to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]
to move (i.e. relocate oneself)/to move (sth relatively heavy or bulky)/to shift/to copy indiscriminately
to sell off/to get rid of in a sale
to sell/to offer for sale/to put on the market
to recycle/to reclaim/to retrieve/to recover/to recall (a defective product)
